page.title: 12Population and Occupations
page.content: The population of Pitlessie and it's locality has remained relatively static since the 1950's- around{300. This can be contrasted with a thriving population of over{500}living here at the turn of the century. A substantial proportion of residents in and around Pitlessie are older, retired people who have lived,if not all,at least the greater part of their lives,in the village. An emerging and increasing second category of inhabitants is the young family unit which has chosen to live in a small village environment for the obvious advantages of rural life. Occupations are predominately {farming-related,}thereafter people are generally employed in{light {industry/manufacturing}in the adjacent towns of{Cupar}and{Glenrothes.
